html: The Way of Holiness—the return road to Jehovah’s holy mountain (Isaiah 27:13; 56:7; 57:13b)—now cleared of obstacles (Isaiah 40:3-4; 57:14; 62:10), is traveled by his holy and valiant ones who survive Jehovah’s destruction of the wicked in his Day of Judgment (Isaiah 4:3; 13:3; 62:10-12). These hail from the four directions of the earth and witness Jehovah’s coming to Zion (Isaiah 11:11-12; 43:5-7; 49:11-12). Those who remain unclean, on the other hand—the reprobates who wander the highways of Jehovah’s people—perish at the hands of wild animals or other miscreants (Isaiah 5:29; 15:9; 56:9).
